alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Pope; Stevens (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Douglas, northwestern Pope and Stevens Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1144 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Clitherall to 5 miles southwest of Elbow Lake to near Clinton. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kensington, Carlos, Lowry and Starbuck. This includes the following highways... Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 81 and 110. U.S. Highway 59 between mile markers 154 and 177. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central and west central Minnesota.
